modules.description: This module constructs margin configurations for layout spacing using a record type with top, right, bottom, and left integer fields. It provides functions to initialize margins uniformly across all edges, separately for vertical/horizontal pairs, or for specific corners, catering to use cases like UI component alignment and

This module defines various border styles for boxes using specific character symbols for each corner and edge. It provides predefined border styles like single, double, rounded, bold, and others, along with a way to define custom borders. The main operations include selecting a border style and retrieving its corresponding symbol set for rendering borders around content.

This module enables creation and modification of rectangular spacing configurations through a record type with `top`, `right`, `bottom`, and `left` integer fields. It supports ergonomic construction patterns like symmetric horizontal/vertical padding, individual side adjustments, and corner pair combinations, primarily serving layout systems or document formatting workflows where structured whitespace is required. Functions such as `leftRight` specifically facilitate horizontal padding definitions for alignment or margin/indentation scenarios.

This module renders text within bordered frames using configurable alignment, padding, margin, and border styles. It operates on strings and structured layout configurations, supporting precise control over visual formatting for terminal UIs or text-based reports. Key use cases include generating aligned, bordered text blocks with customizable spacing and borders for console applications.
